data.title: The 30+ Best Ramya Movies
data.meta_description: Over 100 filmgoers have voted on the 30+ Best Ramya Movies. Current Top 3: Excuse Me, Mussanjemaatu, Abhi
data.text:
Ranked By

593 votes

156 voters

Voting Rules

Vote for your favorite movies, regardless of critic reviews or how big the role was.

List of the best Ramya movies, ranked best to worst with movie trailers when available. Ramya's highest grossing movies have received a lot of accolades over the years, earning millions upon millions around the world. The order of these top Ramya movies is decided by how many votes they receive, so only highly rated Ramya movies will be at the top of the list. Ramya has been in a lot of films, so people often debate each other over what the greatest Ramya movie of all time is. If you and a friend are arguing about this then use this list of the most entertaining Ramya films to end the squabble once and for all.

If you think the best Ramya role isn't at the top, then upvote it so it has the chance to become number one. The greatest Ramya performances didn't necessarily come from the best movies, but in most cases they go hand in hand.

List ranges from Anthu Inthu Preethi Banthu to Lucky, plus much more.

"This list answers the questions, "What are the best Ramya movies?" and "What are the greatest Ramya roles of all time?"

If you're a fan of Ramya, then check out our lists of the best Radhika Pandit and Aindrita Ray movies as well.

1

Excuse Me

Ramya, Sumalatha, Ajay Rao

Released : 2003

Directed by : Prem

Excuse Me is a 2003 released Kannada film.

2

Sudeep, Ramya, Ramesh Bhat

Released : 2008

Directed by : Mahesh

Mussanjemaatu is a 2008 Romantic film starring Sudeep and Ramya. The film was directed by Mahesh. The movie is produced by Suresh Jain. The music of the film was launched on 4 April 2008. The movie was released on 16 May 2008 in India. And also released in USA. In USA San Jose on 27 June 2008, in New Jersey on 11 July 2008, in Dallas on 26 July 2008, in Atlanta on 9 August 2008, in Los Angeles on 24 August 2008, in Laurel on 20 September 2008, in Novi on 27 September 2008, in Houston on 11 October 2008, in Seattle on 18 October 2008, in Boston on 26 October 2008, in Cary on 8 November 2008 and in Milpitas on 13 March 2010. And also released in Canada - Toronto on 30 November 2008. Mussanje Maatu has been remade in Bengali with the name Achena Prem which was released on 8 July 2011.

3

Abhi

Puneeth Rajkumar, Ramya, Umashri

Released : 2003

Directed by : Dinesh Baboo

Abhi is a 2003 Kannada language film written and directed by Dinesh Babu. The film stars Puneet Rajkumar and Ramya, making her debut, in the lead roles. This is the second film for Puneet Rajkumar in lead role. Veteran Kannada actor Rajkumar sang a soundtrack for the film composed by Gurukiran. The film was remade in Telugu as Abhimanyu.

4

Sanju Weds Geetha

Suhasini Maniratnam, Ramya, Brinda Parekh

Sanju Weds Geetha is a 2011 Kannada film in the romance genre starring Srinagar Kitty and Ramya in the lead roles. It was directed and written by actor-director Nagashekar and produced by Pramod Narayan. While Jassie Gift composed the soundtrack, Sadhu Kokila composed the background score. The film released on 1 April 2011. The film was hugely successful at the box-office upon release and won many critical acclaims and awards including the Filmfare Awards South and Suvarna Film Awards in various categories.

5

Arasu

Shriya Saran, Puneeth Rajkumar, Meera Jasmine

Released : 2007

Directed by : Mahesh Babu

Arasu is a Kannada film starring Puneeth Rajkumar, Ramya and Meera Jasmine. Popular south Indian actress Shriya Saran also make a cameo appearance in this film. This is Shriya's first Kannada language film. This film made huge expectation among the fans and become a blockbuster.

6

Amitabh Bachchan, Ramya, Ganesh

Released : 2005

Directed by : Nagathihalli Chandrashekar

Amrithadhare is a 2005 Kannada film directed and co-produced by Nagathihalli Chandrashekhar and written by actor Ramesh Aravind. The film was released on 7 October 2005 starring Dhyan and Ramya in lead roles. The music was composed by Mano Murthy. Bollywood actor Amitabh Bachchan has made a guest appearance as himself in this movie. The movie was remade in Telugu as Amrutha Varsham.
